name: Bootstrap-sass-grunt-setup-uxd
body:
#Front-end Sass Grunt Setup Bootstrap Framework (Windows OS)

***

##Initial Setup

Download Node v4.2.2 LTS Windows Installer (.msi) select windows bit version 32-bit/64-bit

[***Nodejs Installer***](https://nodejs.org/en/download/)

Download Latest version and install Git.

[***Git Installer***](https://git-scm.com/downloads)

**Add Path Setup**

1. click **Start** button
2. right click **Computer** select **Properties**
3. click **Advanced system settings**
4. in **Advanced** Tab click **Environment Variables**
5. in System Variables find and click **Path** then click Edit **button**
6. inside **Variable** value add at the end of Path `;C:\Program Files\nodejs;C:\Users\User Name\AppData\Roaming\npm;`  click **OK** button.
7. **Done Good Job!!**

**Open Command Prompt or Git Bash**

type `npm install -g bower` component to use bootstrap-sass.

type  `npm install -g grunt-cli` for Grunt.js installation

***

## Project Setup

* Download Zip file
* Set path where will you create project folder 
* Rename project folder 
* Open Command Prompt or Git Bash and Navigate your project folder directory.  ex.(`cd C:\Users\Name\MyProject`)

## Directory Configuration

Open config.json using notepad

Change the value of "location" to the directory of your project.

ex. `{ "location" : "C:\\Users\\Me\\MyProject" }`

*use double back slashes (\\\\) to escape the backslash string*


## Bower Installation

type `bower install` this will install all components dependencies that are listed inside your _bower.json_ ex.(bootstrap, jQuery, normalize, modernizr and etc.. ).

## Grunt Installation

type `npm install` this will install all node modules dependencies that are listed inside your _package.json_.


### List Grunt dependencies

**`autoprefixer`** - Parse CSS and add vendor prefixes to CSS rules using values from the Can I Use website.

**`grunt-contrib-clean`** - Clean files and folders

**`grunt-contrib-concat`** - Concatenation files for string

**`grunt-contrib-copy`** - Copy files and folders

**`grunt-contrib-htmlmin`** - Minify HTML

**`grunt-contrib-imagemin`** - Minify images

**`grunt-contrib-uglify`** - Minify files with UglifyJS

**`grunt-contrib-watch`** - Run predefined tasks whenever watched file patterns are added, changed or deleted

**`grunt-express`** - Simple grunt task for running an Express server that works great with LiveReload + Watch/Regarde

**`grunt-open`** - Open urls and files from a grunt task

**`grunt-parallel`** - Run commands and tasks in parallel to speed up your build

**`grunt-postcss`** - Apply several post-processors to your CSS using PostCSS.

**`grunt-rev`** - Static file asset revisioning through content hashing

**`grunt-sass`** - Compile Sass to CSS using node-sass

**`grunt-uncss`** - A grunt task for removing unused CSS from your projects with UnCSS. Works across multiple files and supports dynamically injected CSS via PhantomJS

**`imagemin-mozjpeg`** - mozjpeg imagemin plugin

**`matchdep`** - Use globule to filter npm module dependencies by name

**`time-grunt`** - Display the elapsed execution time of grunt tasks

**`cssnano`** - Modular minifier that aims to utilise small modules from the PostCSS

## Folder structure for scss component:

* base
* layout
* modules

In **base** folder, your scss are for text hierarchy, color palette/themes,  mixins functions and custom style button ready to use in website/web-app.

In **layout** folder, your scss are for layout/theme/page structure.

In **modules** folder, your scss are for custom modules and special functions inside your layout, examples are (breadcrumbs, modal, panel, table, thumbnail, forms and etc..).



And lastly, we run this command:

`grunt`

**You are successfully run sass! Good job!!!**
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
